item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã539 ‚Äî January 22, 2025

Unsub¬†¬†|¬†¬†Web¬†Version

Go Weekly

Go 1.24 Release Candidate 2 Released ‚Äî We‚Äôre another step down the road to the eventual release of Go 1.24, and the Go team are particularly keen for you to kick the tires of the second release candidate: ‚ÄúRun it in dev! Run it in prod! File bugs!‚Äù RC2 isn‚Äôt a significant jump from RC1 but the draft release notes continue to improve and Anton Zhiyanov‚Äôs Go 1.24 interactive tour will get you up to¬†speed.

Michael Knyszek

üí° Go 1.23.5 and 1.22.11 have also been released including a couple of security¬†fixes.

Protect Against Bots, Fraud, and Abuse in Real¬†Time ‚Äî With WorkOS Radar you can detect, verify and block harmful behaviour, protecting your app with advanced device fingerprinting. Stop fake signups, stop free tier abuse, and stop bot attacks and brute force attempts¬†today.

Workos sponsor

‚ñ∂¬†¬†How to Build an MMO Game with Godot 4 and Go ‚Äî A thirteen video YouTube series on building a multiplayer online game using the popular Godot game engine (no relation to Go) and with Go handling the¬†backend.

Tristan Batchler

IN BRIEF:

  • IDE developer JetBrains has launched the Early Access Program for GoLand¬†2025.1, its popular Go IDE. One cool thing about the EAP is they're free to use so can act as an extended trial of¬†sorts.

  • For Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS) users, gomaxecs provides a way to automatically set GOMAXPROCS based on ECS task and container CPU limits.

  • üïπÔ∏è ParaGopher is a retro style arcade game written with Ebitengine.

‚ñ∂¬†¬†Go in the Smallest of Places ‚Äî A GopherCon 2024 talk about the potential and technicalities of using TinyGo to build Go-powered systems on¬†microcontrollers.

Patricio Whittingslow

üìÑ Mind the convT: Avoiding convT Performance Bottlenecks ‚Äì The creators of a Go-powered database system explain how they tackled interface-related bottlenecks in their¬†code. Max Hoffman

üìÑ 'I Made an Online PS1 Game and Connected It to a PS4' ‚Äì Delightfully esoteric. The game is written in C but Go is used to tie everything together behind the¬†scenes. Carl Llewellyn

üìÑ SQL Transactions in Go: The Good Way Thibaut Rousseau

üìÑ Go Interfaces: Why, How and When Noam Yadgar

üìÑ How to Write Better Tests in Go Jakub Jarosz

üõ† Code & Tools

Forgejo 10.0: A Go-Powered Self-Hosted Software Forge ‚Äî Think Gitea (indeed, it‚Äôs a fork of it ‚Äì more on that here) but with even more features make it a full on GitHub replacement. It powers the Codeberg platform and you can see it in action in Forgejo‚Äôs own repo. A new version 10.0 has just¬†dropped.

Forgejo Team

asyncmachine-go: A Declarative Control Flow Library ‚Äî Implements AOP and the actor model through a clock-based state machine for building autonomous, stateful¬†workflows.

Kentaro Hibino

gno.land Offers Grants & Bounties for Go-Powered Decentralized Apps ‚Äî App builders, Go enthusiasts, tinkerers: come and build on gno.land, a smart contract platform for a freer, fairer¬†world.

gno.land sponsor

Bunster: Compile Shell Scripts to Static Binaries ‚Äî bash scripts are already quite portable, but if you want to transpile them to Go and turn them into binaries, here you¬†go.

Yassine Benaid

  • VHS 0.9 ‚Äì CLI 'home video recorder'. "Write terminal GIFs as code for integration testing and demoing your CLI¬†tools." v0.9 adds a Wait keyword for waiting for certain conditions before continuing¬†(as above).

  • ü§ñ Mods 1.7 ‚Äì Charm's pipeline-able AI CLI client. Now with improved GitHub Copilot support and OpenAI o1¬†support.

  • ‚òéÔ∏é phonenumbers 1.5 ‚Äì Go port of Google's libphonenumber library for parsing and validating phone¬†numbers.

  • GoReleaser 2.6 ‚Äì Build/release binaries for multiple¬†platforms. v2.6 gains Bun and Deno support.

  • OpenTelemetry-Go 1.34 ‚Äì OpenTelemetry Go API and¬†SDK. Now requires Go¬†1.22+.

  • Notify 1.3 ‚Äì Library to send notifications to various¬†services.

  • gocryptfs 2.5 ‚Äì Encrypted overlay filesystem written in¬†Go.

  • Inngest 1.4 ‚Äì Stateful workflow orchestration platform.

  • sqlc 1.28 ‚Äì Generate type-safe Go code from¬†SQL.

  • Miniflux 2.2.5 ‚Äì Go-powered feed reader app.

„Äë

item.title: „ÄêAn interactive tour of Go 1.24„Äë1.24ÁöÑ‰∫íÂä®‰πãÊóÖ
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã538 ‚Äî January 15, 2025

Unsub¬†¬†|¬†¬†Web¬†Version

Go Weekly

An Interactive Tour of Go 1.24 ‚Äî A list of all the significant new 1.24 features. Each is accompanied by interactive, runnable examples so you can see generic type aliases in action, make (and clean up) weak pointers, play with file access, and see benchmarks for the new faster map¬†implementation. Go 1.24 is expected to land in the next month or two, with RC2 likely later this¬†week.

Anton Zhiyanov

üí° If you've not experienced Anton's Go tours before, you might also enjoy the Go 1.23 interactive¬†tour.

The First Newsletter Dedicated to Product Engineers ‚Äî The fastest growing startups increasingly rely on product engineers. They can both figure out what to build and actually build it. Product for Engineers is dedicated to sharing the skills and strategies needed to succeed in this¬†role.

PostHog sponsor

if got, want: A Simple Way to Write Better Go Tests ‚Äî ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs an excellent Go testing pattern that too few people know. I can teach it to you in 30 seconds‚Äù is quite the pitch. The trick is using both assignments and a comparison on a single if line to make a test easier to read ‚Äî¬†it‚Äôs even used in the standard¬†library.

Michael Lynch

Gophers Pack: A Collection of Gopher Pictures and Design¬†Elements ‚Äî If you want some handy Go gopher themed images to use for a project, blog post, or presentation, this myriad of cute CC0 (public domainish) elements could be a big help. We use them a lot in this newsletter and Maria has recently added a variety of winter themed¬†options.

Maria Letta

A Practical Example of Dependency Inversion using Plugins ‚Äî An example of using Clean Architecture principles with Go‚Äôs plugin package to create an app that‚Äôs adaptable and extendable without modifying the core source¬†code.

Christian Ekrem

Realizing Why Go Reflection Restricts What Struct Fields Can Be Modified ‚Äî Private (unexported) fields can‚Äôt be modified, even when using reflection. When looking at this through Rust-colored glasses, it makes more¬†sense.

Chris Siebenmann

üìÑ How HTTP/2 Works and How to Enable It in Go ‚Äì One of Phuong‚Äôs typically thorough¬†explanations. Phuong Le

üìÑ Designing a Distributed Circuit Breaker for Disabling Webhook Endpoints ‚Äì If you‚Äôre consuming a lot of third-party APIs, this could help keep your queues from¬†clogging. Raymond Tukpe (Core Gateway)

üì∫ The Creator of Ghostty Talks Zig over Go ‚Äì Controversial. Mitchell Hashimoto (of HashiCorp fame) has recently built Ghostty, a fast new terminal emulator, in Zig. But why not¬†Go? ThePrimeTime

üì∫ Implementing a Random Art Generation Algorithm ‚Äì A thorough walkthrough of a way to generate curious graphical¬†elements. package main

üìÑ Making 'Beautiful' API Keys ‚Äì Making auth tokens/keys more attractive probably shouldn‚Äôt be a priority, but if you want/need to, uuidkey may be for¬†you. Jack Spirou (AgentStation)

üìÑ Modifying Private Variables of a Struct with unsafe and reflect ‚Äì Remember it‚Äôs called unsafe for a¬†reason... Darshan N A

üìÑ Scaling LLMs with Go: How We Serve Millions of LLM Requests John Wang (Assembled)

üìÑ We Removed 335 LOC with One Go Package ‚Äì Going from generating a huge number of ffmpeg directives to a cloud-based audio transformation¬†approach. Poxate

üìÑ How rqlite, a Go-Powered SQLite-Based Database, is Tested Philip O'Toole

üõ† Code & Tools

go-mail v0.6: A Library for Sending Emails ‚Äî If you‚Äôve got email to send, go-mail can do the job. v0.6 adds support for S/IME signing, SMTP auth auto-discovery, Unix domain socket support, and a ‚Äòquick send‚Äô feature.

Winni Neessen et al.

ebpf-go 0.17: A Way to Work with eBPF from Go ‚Äî A pure Go library to read, modify and load eBPF programs for use directly by the Linux kernel (eBPF is a neat technology worth exploring if you‚Äôre not familiar with it yet). The new 0.17 release requires Go 1.22+ and introduces a new API to work with global¬†variables.

Beckers et al.

go-haystack: Track Personal Devices via Apple's 'Find My' Network ‚Äî An interesting way to track personal Bluetooth devices via Apple‚Äôs massive ‚ÄúFind My‚Äù network by way of TinyGo and a little extra¬†hardware.

Ron Evans

  • GoCV 0.40 ‚Äì The Go bindings for OpenCV 4 add support for OpenCV¬†4.11.0.

  • pgxmock 4.4 ‚Äì Mock driver to test Postgres interactions in¬†Go.

  • Cloudflare Go 4.0 ‚Äì Official library for the Cloudflare¬†API.

  • FrankenPHP 1.4 ‚Äì Modern Go-powered PHP app¬†server.

„Äë

item.title: „ÄêA continued focus on the benefits of Go 1.24„ÄëÁªßÁª≠ÂÖ≥Ê≥®GO 1.24ÁöÑÂ•ΩÂ§Ñ
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã540 ‚Äî January 29, 2025

Unsub¬†¬†|¬†¬†Web¬†Version

Go Weekly

Go 1.24's go tool is One of the Best Additions in Years ‚Äî Go 1.24 isn‚Äôt even fully here yet (though rc2 is out) and people are already very excited. One major enhancement is the new go tool command and tool directive in go.mod, which simplifies handling dependencies for dev-time tooling and improves performance by caching runs and reducing dependency¬†bloat.

Jamie Tanna

üí° John Howard has another take in Exploring the go tool support in Go¬†1.24

Keep Your Apps Fast and Error-Free with Honeybadger ‚Äî Honeybadger helps you fix errors, eliminate performance bottlenecks, and dig into the details faster than ever before. With support for Go, Ruby, and 8 other languages, it‚Äôs the best way to gain real-time insights into your application‚Äôs health and¬†performance.

Honeybadger sponsor

Proposal: A Way to Reduce Error Handling Boilerplate with ? ‚Äî A proposal to streamline error handling using a ? operator. This new syntax could reduce boilerplate by optionally handling errors and returning early or executing an error handling¬†block.

Ian Lance Taylor

IN BRIEF:

  • Cloudflare published an interesting blog post about how they handle over 100GB/sec of logs and Go sits at the heart of it.

  • JetBrains, the developers of the GoLand IDE, has unveiled Junie, a new 'coding agent' to which you'll be able to delegate various coding tasks in future. It's behind a waitlist for now but looks promising.

  • The OpenTelemetry project has announced Alibaba, Datadog and Quesma have joined forces to enable the use of zero-code, vendor-neutral compile-time instrumentation in Go apps.

Maps are Faster in Go 1.24 ‚Äî It‚Äôs thanks to so-called Swiss Tables and you don‚Äôt need to make any changes to benefit from the new implementation. Just upgrading to Go 1.24 will unlock the¬†gains.

Byte Size Go

Go Slices: Shared Memory and append() Pitfalls ‚Äî A look at some potential tripping points in Go when it comes to working with slices and sub-slices. Rob Pike‚Äôs 2013 post on the official Go blog is also a great resource on this¬†topic.

Patrick A. Noblet

Protect Against Bots, Fraud, and Abuse in Real Time ‚Äî WorkOS Radar protects your app with advanced device fingerprinting ‚Äî stop fake signups, free tier abuse, bot attacks and brute force attempts¬†today.

WorkOS sponsor

üìÑ Scripting with Go ‚Äì How to ‚Äòsprinkle some Unix shell fairy dust on your Go programs‚Äô to build shell-like data pipeline operations. John Arundel

üìÑ So You Wanna Write Kubernetes Controllers? ‚Äì From someone who leads LinkedIn‚Äôs Kubernetes management, no¬†less. Ahmet Alp Balkan

üìÑ Bridging Rust and Native Go ‚Äì ‚Äúa feasible way to build native Go bindings from Rust and C components with the magic power of purego and libffi¬†behinds.‚Äù Hanchin Hsieh

üîí FIPS Mode for Red Hat Go Toolset ‚Äì Red Hat Go Toolset is a Red Hat distribution of Go that lets apps use OpenSSL for¬†crypto. David Benoit

üìÑ cURL Project and Go Security Teams Reject CVSS as Broken Sarah Gooding (Socket)

üìÑ Deploy a Server using Go with GitLab and Google Cloud Claire Champernowne (GitLab)

üõ† Code & Tools

Centrifugo v6: A Scalable Real-Time Messaging Server ‚Äî Imagine an open source, self-hosted equivalent to Pubnub or Pusher for passing messages to users of real-time apps over WebSocket, HTTP streaming, SSE, and more. It‚Äôs language agnostic, but written in Go. GitHub¬†repo.

Centrifugal

Maddy 0.8: A Composable All-in-One Mail Server ‚Äî Can work as an MTA, accept messages via SMTP, store messages and even provide access to them over IMAP. v0.8 requires Go 1.23+ but adds support for HAProxy‚Äôs PROXY protocol and handling DNS-01 challenge¬†records.

Max Mazurov

  • üìä go-echarts 2.5 ‚Äì Charting and data visualization library that uses Apache¬†ECharts. You can see examples in the¬†docs.

  • FerretDB v2.0 RC ‚Äì A Go-powered MongoDB implementation built on top of Postgres and¬†DocumentDB.

  • gRPC-Go 1.70 ‚Äì Go implementation of gRPC for HTTP/2 based¬†RPC.

  • Ergo 2.15 ‚Äì A modern IRC server (daemon/ircd) written in Go.

  • Tokenizer 0.3 ‚Äì Go implementation of OpenAI's¬†tokenizer.

  • quic-go 0.49 ‚Äì Pure Go QUIC¬†implementation.

  • GoProxy 1.7 ‚Äì HTTP proxy library for Go.

  • Garble 0.14 ‚Äì Obfuscation for Go¬†builds.

üì∞¬†Classifieds

üí° Modern Infrastructure Demands a Modern Approach to Privileged Access - Read White¬†Paper.

By swapping AWS MSK for WarpStream, Pixel Federation drastically reduced Kafka costs and eliminated complex VPC peering.

üì¢¬† Elsewhere in Dev

A quick roundup of some of other interesting stories in the broader developer landscape, in case you've missed them:

  • GitHub has been doing some work on improving issues, by adding support for sub-issues, issue types, and advanced search for¬†issues.

  • SRCL is a neat new suite of React components for creating webapps with a monospaced, terminal-style aesthetic.

  • If you ever need to work with JavaScript server-side, Bun 1.2 is a huge release for an increasingly popular, high performance JavaScriptCore-based Node-a-like. It 'just works' for a lot of stuff where Node gives me¬†headaches.

  • Like a deep, technical read? Using the most unhinged AVX-512 instruction to make the fastest phrase search algorithm goes into ridiculous¬†depth.

  • Take a look at every byte that goes over the network when making a real Postgres query over TLS (above). Everything is annotated to help you understand the¬†complexity.

item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã541 ‚Äî February 5, 2025

Unsub¬†¬†|¬†¬†Web¬†Version

Go Weekly

How a Malicious Package Exploited Module Proxy Caching for Persistence ‚Äî Researchers have uncovered a sophisticated supply chain attack exploiting both typosquatting and then Go‚Äôs module proxying caching to remain undetected for years. It‚Äôs worth understanding the mechanism behind this in case you run into it¬†yourself.

Kirill Boychenko (Socket)

Proposal: math/rand/v2 Worked, Let's Do sync/v2! ‚Äî Creating ‚Äòv2‚Äô versions of standard packages is Go‚Äôs compromise for modernization vs stability. With the evolution of math/rand a success, Ian thinks synchronization primitives are due an upgrade too. Much of the value here comes from a month‚Äôs worth of discussion, including people‚Äôs discontent over the ‚Äòv2‚Äô approach (outlined further¬†here).

Ian Lance Taylor

Upcoming Workshop on Building Backend Web Apps in Go ‚Äî Join us for a two day workshop (either online or in person) and develop your Go know-how. We'll focus on using Go to build backend web apps, along with learning Go data structures, interfaces, how to write unit tests, and¬†more.

Frontend Masters sponsor

Go Programs Freezing When Launched by Steam ‚Äî Ebitengine‚Äôs lead developer reported an unusual bug to the Steam team ‚Äì Go programs (e.g. games) launched by the popular Steam game launcher were failing due to Steam interfering with Go‚Äôs runtime in some way. This has since become a bug being discussed on the Go repo with some workarounds but no full resolution¬†yet.

Hajime Hoshi

IN BRIEF:

  • While we wait for of Go 1.24's final release, Go 1.23.6 and Go 1.22.12 have been released including a security fix to crypto/elliptic as well as a couple of tiny bug¬†fixes.

  • Originally an elaborate set of shell scripts, the latest version of the asdf version manager sees a complete rewrite to Go. (I use this for managing my Ruby versions ‚Äì it's good.)

httptap: View HTTP/HTTPS Requests Made by Any Linux Program ‚Äî It uses Linux-only network namespaces for now, but this is a Go-powered process-scoped HTTP tracer you can run without root privileges. It even decrypts TLS traffic by generating a CA on the fly. Handy for debugging or seeing if dependencies or apps are ‚Äòphoning¬†home,‚Äô¬†perhaps..

Monastic Academy for the Preservation of Life on Earth

How to Release to Homebrew with GoReleaser, GitHub Actions and Semantic Release ‚Äî The steps involved in automating the release of a Go project (maybe your new command line tool or TUI?) that‚Äôs available via Homebrew (as most commonly used on¬†macOS).

Billy Hadlow

Product Management Is Broken. Engineers Can Fix It ‚Äî How redefining how PMs and engineers work together helped PostHog optimize everything they do for speed and¬†autonomy.

PostHog sponsor

üìÑ Real-Time Batching in Go Viktor Nikolaiev

üìÑ Recover Panics in All Goroutines You Start Emir Ribic

üõ† Code & Tools

Zog: 'Next Gen' Schema Validation for Go ‚Äî Zod is a popular TypeScript-based runtime schema validation library and Zog is a take on the same idea in Go so you can define validations and run them against values and structs. GitHub¬†repo.

Tristan Mayo

etree 1.5: A Library to Parse and Generate XML Easily ‚Äî A simple, straightforward approach to working with XML in Go, inspired by Python‚Äôs ElementTree. XML documents are represented as trees for easily traversal and you can create, import, modify and save XML. Queries can be done with a XPath-like¬†approach.

Brett Vickers

Feluda: A Tool to Analyze the Licences of Dependencies ‚Äî It‚Äôs a Rust-powered project but which can be used to process the dependencies of Go, Rust or Node.js projects and return a report (or show a TUI interface) on potentially restrictive licenses that¬†apply.

Kumar Anirudha

üîä¬†volume-go: A Cross-Platform Way to Control Sound Volume ‚Äî Leaning on a different technique for each OS, it supports macOS, Linux, and Windows. If you want it wrapped up into a nice Go TUI, Volgo is for¬†you.

itchyny

  • üßã Bubble Tea 1.3 ‚Äì A popular way to build terminal apps. v1.3 now handles interrupts better and take your CTRL+Cs 'with grace and¬†poise.'

  • genqlient 0.8 ‚Äì Generate type-safe code to query a GraphQL¬†API.

  • Micro 5.0 ‚Äì Go distributed system abstractions /¬†platform.

  • rain 2.2 ‚Äì BitTorrent client and library for¬†Go.

  • fzf 0.59 ‚Äì Popular command-line fuzzy¬†finder.

  • GoBGP 3.34 ‚Äì BGP implementation in¬†Go.

üì∞¬†Classifieds

üí° Modern Infrastructure Demands a Modern Approach to Privileged Access - Read White¬†Paper.

üêò PostgreSQL user? Check out our sister newsletter, Postgres Weekly ‚Äì the next issue goes out¬†tomorrow.

üïπÔ∏è¬† And for a little fun..

A Minesweeper Game Written in Go ‚Äî A cute example of putting together a game in such a way that it not only runs on the desktop in the usual way, but can be taken to the Web too. The effects are cute, too ‚Äì this is a great use of the Ebitengine game engine. The GitHub repo is certainly worth a look if you're trying to reach similar¬†ends.
